finland_Cuisine.name: Lohikeitt
finland_Cuisine.description: Lohikeitto is a creamy Finnish salmon soup, similar to laxsoppa in Sweden. It incorporates chunks of salmon fillet, diced potatoes, and carrots cooked in a flavorful, buttery broth infused with fish stock and cream.

finland_Cuisine.name: Lihapull
finland_Cuisine.description: The crispy, golden Finnish meatballs are traditionally made with beef, occasionally with ground pork. They're seasoned with allspice and combined with breadcrumbs, eggs, and onions.

finland_Cuisine.name: Munkki
finland_Cuisine.description: Munkki are Finnish deep-fried doughnuts made with buttery, cardamom-flavored dough. They're often filled with sweet fruit or shaped as thick rings rolled in fine sugar.

finland_Cuisine.name: Mämmi
finland_Cuisine.description: Mämmi is a traditional Finnish dessert made from rye flour, rye malt, and water. It's flavored with dark molasses syrup and has a thick, porridge-like consistency.

finland_Cuisine.name: Rieska
finland_Cuisine.description: Rieska is an unleavened Finnish flatbread made with flour, water, and salt. It's enjoyed across Finland in varying textures, from thin and crispy to thick and soft.

finland_Cuisine.name: Hernekeit
finland_Cuisine.description: Hernekeitto is a thick Finnish split pea soup typically cooked with pork. It's traditionally served on Thursdays, followed by a pannukakku (oven-baked pancake).

finland_Cuisine.name: Karjalanpiirakka
finland_Cuisine.description: Karjalanpiirakka is a Finnish pasty made with various fillings like rice porridge or mashed potatoes, wrapped in a thin rye crust. The top is often left open.

finland_Cuisine.name: Silakat
finland_Cuisine.description: Silakat is a traditional Finnish dish made from small Baltic herring, dredged in flour and fried, often served with butter and bread.

finland_Cuisine.name: Poronkäristys
finland_Cuisine.description: Poronkäristys is a traditional Finnish dish made by sautéing reindeer meat, often served with mashed potatoes and lingonberry sauce.

finland_Cuisine.name: Munavoi
finland_Cuisine.description: Munavoi is a simple Finnish spread made from whipped butter and mashed hard-boiled eggs. It's lightly seasoned with salt and pepper.

finland_Cuisine.name: Mustikkapiirakka
finland_Cuisine.description: Mustikkapiirakka is a traditional Finnish blueberry pie made with a buttery crust, topped with fresh blueberries and baked to perfection.

finland_Cuisine.name: Kalakeitt
finland_Cuisine.description: Kalakeitto is a classic Finnish fish soup made with fish chunks, potatoes, carrots, and onions, simmered in a rich, buttery broth.

finland_Cuisine.name: Kaalilaatikko
finland_Cuisine.description: Kaalilaatikko is a Finnish casserole made with ground beef or pork, cabbage, and rice, seasoned with molasses syrup and herbs like marjoram and thyme.

finland_Cuisine.name: Karjalanpaisti
finland_Cuisine.description: Karjalanpaisti is a Finnish stew made with pork, beef, and mutton, simmered with vegetables like potatoes, carrots, and onions, and flavored with peppercorns, allspice, and bay leaves.

finland_Cuisine.name: Kalakuko
finland_Cuisine.description: Kalakukko is a traditional Finnish pie made with fish and bacon or pork, baked inside a thick rye bread crust.

finland_Cuisine.name: Mustamakkara
finland_Cuisine.description: Mustamakkara is a blood sausage made from pig's blood, pork, rye, and flour. It's known for its dark color and juicy center.

finland_Cuisine.name: Nakki
finland_Cuisine.description: Nakki is a small pre-cooked sausage popular in Finland, similar to cocktail sausages or frankfurters.

finland_Cuisine.name: Joulutorttu
finland_Cuisine.description: Joulutorttu is a traditional Christmas pastry made from puff pastry filled with plum jam, shaped like a star or pinwheel.

finland_Cuisine.name: Maksalaatikko
finland_Cuisine.description: Maksalaatikko is a Finnish liver casserole made with rice, liver, eggs, and sautéed onions, occasionally with bacon or raisins.

finland_Cuisine.name: Porkkanalaatikko
finland_Cuisine.description: Porkkanalaatikko is a Finnish casserole made with grated carrots, rice, eggs, and breadcrumbs, baked until golden brown.
